@hm just has a campaign out, with beautiful pictures taken in Brasil, soundtrack you can hear with Brasilian music, but oh the irony: HM is using cotton from areas that should be preserved ( is HM aware of the massive floodings in south Brasil right now?) This is from april 19 th. : A year-long Earthsight investigation found that fiber certified by ethical supply chain organization Better Cotton was grown on “stolen” and “deforested” land in Brazil. A year-long investigation by nonprofit Earthsight published last week found that cotton grown on what the group said is “stolen” and “deforested” land in Brazil’s Cerrado region appeared in garments approved by supply chain certifier Better Cotton and sold by retail giants H&M and Zara parent company Inditex.
The traced cotton is grown in the Brazilian state of Bahia by two of the country’s largest producers, SLC Agrícola and Grupo Horita, per the report, which said both companies have been fined repeatedly for environmental violations. The investigation traced the cotton to eight Asia-based clothing manufacturers that supply H&M and Inditex with “millions” of garments, per the investigation. So it is absolutely provoking that HM ignores that and still use the Brasilian florests to shoot their campaign, like they care..

@ahh_sharon_ Hello, Sharon! We greatly appreciate your interest on checking this beautiful dress. Rest assured, we will help you locate the item and see what we can do. We're able to find the item and you may check it on the app or our website using this link https://www2.hm.com/en_au/productpage.1217947003.html. As of now, this item is still labeled as coming soon which means we're still about to release this item online in Australia but we currently don't have the exact date to when this will be available for purchase. However, we suggest keeping an eye on the item online using the link provided for you to be notified once it gets released and for you to place an order since this item is only exclusive for online purchase. 

Kindly refer to the steps below to place an order successfully. 

1. Kindly log on to your H&M account by using our website through this link https://www2.hm.com/en_au/index.html. 

2. Add the boots to your shopping bag. 

3. Check all the necessary information on your H&M account(email, delivery address and billing address) 

4. Proceed to checkout. 

After a few minutes, you will receive an email to confirm your order. To know more about our order and deliveries, please refer to this link https://www2.hm.com/en_au/customer-service/shippinganddelivery.html. Hope this helps!

H&M,was ist mit eurem Service los? Seit wann seid ihr so schlecht geworden?Ich bin jahrelanger ,zufriedener Kunde und habe immer gerne und nicht wenig bei euch gekauft.In letzter Zeit passieren aber viele Fehler.entweder bekomme ich eine falsche Ware oder meine Retoure wird nicht richtig verbucht.Bis jetzt hat das aber immer über den Chat gut geklappt und man konnte mir immer helfen.Heute aber,stellte ich wieder fest dass eine Retoure falsch verbucht wurde und wandte mich an den Chat in der App und die Dame sagt mir ,da bei mir in letzter Zeit öfters was falsch verbucht worden ist,werdet ihr mir nichts mehr korrigieren weil ein Verpackungsfehler oder buchungsfehler eurer Seits ausgeschlossen werden kann.Wie dreist ist das denn bitte??!!! Ich soll für etwas zahlen was ich mir nicht behalten habe! Mir wird unterstellt es sei mein Fehler.Stellt euch mal vor ich bestelle was teures und ihr kommt mir dann so!das ist eine bodenlose Frechheit! Ich bin sauer,verärgert ,wütend,enttäuscht.Ihr habt mich definitiv als Kundin verloren ,denn so etwas habe ich noch nie wo gesehen.nicht bei zara,Mango,weekday,Stradivarius oder sonst wo.schämt euch!

As H&M is holding its annual meeting of shareholders, it's time to address the cruelty behind down. I urge H&M to ditch down and embrace cruelty-free alternatives. Let's make fashion compassionate for all beings.
Please, please, please help put an end to the abuse of ducks and stop profiting from their suffering! No animal deserves to be tortured.

Please end your support of stabbing ducks in their neck and making their final experience of life excruciatingly agonising. The pain and terror these animals suffer when their legs are cut off is beyond comprehension.  They have no morphine whatsoever. Duck feathers are ripped out of them and this whole process is not “responsibly sourced” down that you market to customers on @hm products.  Each bird will have felt the pain of the knife being driven into their throat. If you have eyes and ears, open them. Customers do not want these animals to suffer the way that they do. People do not deserve to be lied to and told the feathers (down) are responsibly sourced when they are not. Please make emotionally intelligent decisions and have greater awareness of the cruelty you are dealing with.  Customers will respect you more for buying Plantbased materials. Plant materials are good to work with and prevent the physical torture of stabbing duck necks and cutting off their legs when they are alive. Please do not commit to this toxic down industry which is far from transparent.  H&M is time to be responsible and aware of what customers want.  Plantbased cruelty-free, sustainable materials please.  This is the future. The future is NOW. #saynotodown
Ducks are stabbed in the neck and their legs are cut off. Stop selling that cruelty products!😭
